title: Frank Lampard admits Chelsea must 'take a small step back' with N'Golo Kante to allow full recovery
text:
Frank Lampard admits Chelsea have to take a ‘step back’ with N’Golo Kante to allow him to make a full recovery after his injury-hit start to the season.

Influential midfielder Kante is still nursing a groin problem that he picked up on France duty during the recent international break.

He will again be sidelined for Saturday's tea time trip to Burnley and Lampard is refusing to put a timescale on how long the World Cup winner will be out.

Frank Lampard says Chelsea must allow N'Golo Kante time to make a full recovery from injury

Kante, 28, started the season still feeling the effects of a knee injury that threatened his participation in the Europa League final victory against Arsenal.

Kante has also suffered ankle and hamstring problems this season and been restricted to just five starts and only been able to make back-to-back starts twice.

Lampard said: ‘N’Golo won’t be ready [for Burnley]. He is outside on his own, physical work to deal with a few issues. We need to get him right now because he has been in and out through the whole season as we know.

The Chelsea boss refused to put a timescale on the length of the World Cup winner's absence

‘I just want him fit so I think that he has played a lot of football for four years. He has had a big injury off the back of last season.

‘So I think that maybe we, I, he is suffering from that big injury and a little fall out from that.

‘I think now it is time to take a small step back just to get his fitness up and be confident that we won’t have a domino effect with small injuries so there’s no actual time frame.’
description: Chelsea star Kante (pictured) is nursing a groin problem that he picked up with France during the international break. He will again be sidelined for Saturday's tea time trip to Burnley.
